artist: The School of the Master of Mary of Burgundy
creditline:
The Minnich Collection
The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund, 1966
medium: Ink, gouache and gold leaf on vellum
text: The elaborate initial S marks the start of the prayers and readings for Pentecost (Whitsunday), commemorating the descent of the Holy Spirit upon Christ's Apostles. The page was part of a Book of Hours, a compendium of prayer and meditations for lay worshipers to follow throughout the year. The gilded vine with ivy-like leaves, pods, and colorful flowers is typical of French 15th-century manuscript decoration.
title: Leaf from a Book of Hours (recto and verso)
